title: Ayanna Pressley
deleted: Sarah Groh, Pressley's [[chief of staff]], reported that [[panic button]]s that had been installed in the office had been removed some time prior to the [[2021 United States Capitol attack]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Panic Buttons Torn From Pressley's Congressional Office Ahead of Riots: Chief of Staff |url=https://www.nbcboston.com/news/politics/panic-buttons-removed-from-pressleys-congressional-office-ahead-of-riots-chief-of-staff/2279777/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210831184419/https://www.nbcboston.com/news/politics/panic-buttons-removed-from-pressleys-congressional-office-ahead-of-riots-chief-of-staff/2279777/ | archive-date=2021-08-31 | access-date=January 13, 2021 |work=NBC Boston |date=January 13, 2021}}</ref>
